intro: Thladiantha monoeca, commonly known as the single-flowered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Thladiantha monoeca is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
